meta.subject: Expressive Arts
meta.philosophy: Quality, life long education for all which is accessible, inclusive and relevant to individual, national and global needs. The Expressive Arts Syllabus provides quality education aligned with the Competence-Based Curriculum and 21st Century Skills, imparting knowledge, skills, values, and positive attitudes for learners to be productive and useful members of their communities and Zambian society. It facilitates holistic development of physical, mental, emotional, social, spiritual, and moral faculties through hands-on experiences and interaction with nature, integrating cross-cutting themes like National Values and Principles, Life Skills, Health Education, Climate Change, and Financial Education.
meta.competence_learning: The Expressive Arts (EA) Syllabus integrates Art and Design, Music, and Physical Education, emphasizing creativity, analysis, problem-solving, interpersonal and intrapersonal skills, investigations, and aesthetics. It provides opportunities for invigorating, developmental, and educational activities leading to cultural heritage appreciation, social, mental, and emotional growth, fostering healthy habits, teamwork, determination, and problem-solving. Learners engage in musical composition, performance, visual arts, sports, and games for leisure, competition, and livelihood, ensuring all learners, abled and differently-abled, develop to their highest potential and acquire life-long skills.
goals: To provide quality education aligned with the Competence-Based Curriculum and 21st Century Skills.
To impart knowledge, skills, values, and positive attitudes for learners to live and grow into productive and useful members of their communities and the Zambian society.
To facilitate holistic development of learners' physical, mental, emotional, social, spiritual and moral faculties.
To enable learners to develop knowledge, desirable lifelong skills, values and positive attitudes needed for their personal and national development.
To cultivate a mindset, skills, values and positive attitudes that prepare them to live responsible lives and be protected from life threatening vices.
To give an equal opportunity to learners who are abled and differently-abled to develop to their highest potential and to acquire life-long skills.

specific_outcomes: Demonstrate storage of tools, equipment and artifacts
Use movement patterns for specific sports
Compose pictures showing light and shade
Perform rhythmic patterns using learnt musical notes
Perform various styles and forms of Zambian traditional music
Create pictures using various picture making techniques
Design posters based on different themes
